basics.name: Miles
basics.label: Software Developer | Graduate Student
basics.summary: I’m currently studying as a graduate student at McMaster University majoring in Engineering of Systems and Technology.

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

publications.name: GraphSleepNet: Adaptive Spatial-Temporal Graph Convolutional Networks for Sleep Stage Classification
publications.publisher: International Joint Conferences on Artificial Intelligence Organization
publications.summary: Use a novel adaptive spatial-temporal graph convolutional network (AST-GCN) to learn the spatial-temporal features of PSG signals for sleep stage classification.

publications.name: Multi-View Spatial-Temporal Graph Convolutional Networks With Domain Generalization for Sleep Stage Classification
publications.publisher: IEEE Transactions on Neural Systems and Rehabilitation Engineering
publications.summary: Propose a novel multi-view spatial-temporal graph convolutional network (MV-STGCN) to learn the spatial-temporal features of PSG signals for sleep stage classification.

projects.name: English‐speaking practice iOS APP
projects.summary: Developed an English‐speaking practice iOS app using Swift and SwiftUI at ATECHNOVA (Hamilton, ON), integrating Firebase for authentication and data storage, and a Siamese BiLSTM deep learning model for text analysis, deployed on AWS EC2.
